etymologies: Middle English: from Old French lanterne, from Latin lanterna, from Greek lamptēr ‘torch, lamp’, from lampein ‘to shine’

definitions: a lamp with a transparent case protecting the flame or electric bulb, and typically having a handle by which it can be carried or hung
shortDefinitions: lamp with transparent case protecting flame or electric bulb

definitions: a square, curved, or polygonal structure on the top of a dome or a room, with the sides glazed or open so as to admit light

examples.text: the building is well lit by the ring of windows in the octagonal lantern

shortDefinitions: square, curved, or polygonal structure on top of dome or room

definitions: the light chamber at the top of a lighthouse.
shortDefinitions: light chamber at top of lighthouse
